result.execSummary:
The defendant Alaric L Rhodes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all remaining mandatory costs, fees, surcharges and assessments.  Within 18 months or balance to convert to civil judgment.
Huber privileges of no more than 50 hours a week.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.175, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession, body armor and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alaric L Rhodes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund
4/13/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, received and filed.

Defendant Alaric L Rhodes in court with Attorney Paul Arthur Oberer.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Cevell G.  AS TO COUNT #1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve ONE (1) YEAR in the House of Correction with HUBER privileges of no more than 50 hours a week, with credit for ELEVEN (11) DAYS time served with the following condition:  

1) Pay all remaining mandatory costs, fees, surcharges and assessments within EIGHTEEN (18) months or balance to convert to civil judgment;

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession, body armour and Voting.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Alaric L Rhodes in court with Attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  As to the plea:  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Matter is adjourned for sentencing to April 7, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Alaric L Rhodes in court with Attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a status conference.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter is set for a plea/sentencing on February 10, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Alaric L Rhodes in court with Attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Motion hearing.  The defense has not filed a motion.  A stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter is adjourned for a status conference on Decembe 16, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Per Chief Judge Directive 15-19, case is judicially transferred.
Motion hearing at 11-19-2015 01:30 pm
Counsel contacts the Court to reschedule 9/8/15 motion hearing, defense counsel is not available. Matter is adjourned to 11/19.15 at 1:30pm in Br. 35.

Defendant Alaric L Rhodes in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for 09-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Alaric L Rhodes in court with attorney Paul A. Oberer.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #96CF5315 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Jake Puschnig-MPD Officer.    Exhibit #1 is marked, offered and received into evidence.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Exhibit #1 is ordered withdrawn.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/3/15.

15RM027372  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06/01/2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Alaric L Rhodes in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Alaric L Rhodes in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
